etymology.description: 乂 + 乂 - two stacked 'X' marks.
etymology.interpretation: Shows two crossing X shapes placed one above the other, visually evoking intersecting or segmented lines. This image aligns with its use in the Yijing to denote the individual lines that make up trigrams and hexagrams.

examples.chinese: 《易经》中，卦由六爻组成(《易經》中，卦由六爻組成)。
examples.pinyin: Yìjīng zhōng, guà yóu liù yáo zǔchéng.
examples.english: In the Book of Changes, a hexagram is made up of six lines.

examples.chinese: 他研究爻辞的含义(他研究爻辭的含義)。
examples.english: He studies the meanings of the line statements.

examples.chinese: 占卜时要画出阴爻和阳爻(占卜時要畫出陰爻和陽爻)。
examples.pinyin: Zhānbǔ shí yào huà chū yīn-yáo hé yáng-yáo.
examples.english: When divining, one must draw the yin and yang lines.
